nombre: MUSEO DE BORDADOS PASO BLANCO. S. XVI - XVIII
descripcion: In the Monumental Complex of Santo Domingo, the Paso Blanco brotherhood exhibits a collection of splendid embroideries made throughout the history of this brotherhood. You can also visit the beautiful chapel of the Virgen del Rosario. Normal rate: 2,50 eur; Reduced rate: 2 eur (groups, children, pensioners).

nombre: CASTILLO FORTALEZA DEL SOL. S. X - XX
descripcion: Declared a Historic-Artistic Monument in 1931. For centuries, it marked the border between Christians and Muslims. A must-see, it is a thematic space where leisure and culture are combined. Rates Free visit: normal 5 eur; reduced 4 eur. Special pass with two guided visits included (Synagogue and Alfonsina Tower): 10 eur.

nombre: CENTRO PARA LA ARTESANÍA DE LORCA. S. XX
descripcion: This building was built in 1988 and features interesting contemporary architecture by the Murcian Juan Antonio Molina. The façade is the original one from the stables of the Palacio de Guevara. Dedicated to the sale and exhibition of craft products from the Region of Murcia.

nombre: CONVENTO VIRGEN DE LAS HUERTAS. S. XVIII - S. XX
descripcion: S. XVI-XVIII, of interest are the chapel of the Virgin, the sculpture of the Virgen de las Huertas and the staircase of the Tota Pulcra.
The Calvario hermitage complex is one of the most unique in the Region of Murcia. It was built in the 17th century. The idea was to encourage a replacement pilgrimage.

nombre: IGLESIA COLEGIAL SAN PATRICIO. S. XVI - XVIII
descripcion: The most important temple for the people of Lorca. Declared a Historic Monument in 1941 based on a design by Jerónimo Quijano. Built between 1536 and 1780

nombre: MASS, MUSEO AZUL DE LA SEMANA SANTA
descripcion: Museum located in a historic building, the former Hospital de Beneficiencia San Juan de Dios, which exhibits a fine collection of splendid embroidery, its heritage and a journey through the history of the confraternity. It is also possible to visit the adjoining Church of San Francisco (National Monument) at the additional price of 1 €. Normal rate: 2,50 eur. Reduced rate: 2 eur

nombre: MUSEO ARQUEOLÓGICO MUNICIPAL - CASA DE LOS SALAZAR ROSSO. Siglos XVI - XVII
descripcion: Located in the Casa de los Salazar Rosso and later Casa de los Moreno. Museum founded in 1992 that houses an exceptional collection from the Palaeolithic to the Middle Ages. Re-opened (23 December 2015) introducing methods that make it the only Spanish museum with free admission.

nombre: OFICINA DE TURISMO DE LORCA. PLAZA DE ESPAÑA
descripcion: Located in the recently restored Colonel Potousse House, built in the 18th century and completed in 1766. It was restored after the 2011 earthquakes thanks to the Master Plan for Heritage Recovery. It offers information services, advice, ticket sales, guided tours and souvenir sales.

nombre: PALACIO DE GUEVARA. S. XVII - XVIII
descripcion: This 17th century house is one of the best examples of civil baroque in the east of Spain. Its interior courtyard recalls the traces of a convent cloister, with columns of Macael marble.

For a different kind of visit to the city and to go up to the Castle, the best way is to enjoy our Tourist Train. On board this unique transport you will visit the different monuments with the option of having the trip commented by a guide who will show you the façades, the noble houses, the churches...
